section.title: Location-Speakers: Standard Somali
section.para: Standard Somali is based principally on the Northern variety of a group of closely related " Somaloid" language varieties spoken in the Horn of African and Kenya. Standard Somali is spoken throughout the region historically known as Somalia, and in adjacent countries (Djibouti, Ethiopia, Kenya). The paradigms are a combination of Saeed1999 and Orwin1995.

biblioset.title: Somali
biblioset.seriesvolnums: London Oriental and African Language Library. vol. 10

section.title: Index of Paradigm Lexemes: Standard Somali
section.para:
The following lexical items are used in the verbal paradigms:
The following lexical items are used in Standard Somali verbal paradigms:
Lemma Gloss LexProperties Note
yimi come conjClass:prefix
súg wait for conjClass:suffix, subConj:C1
kári cook conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C2A,
yarèe make small (cf. yár ‘small’) conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C2B,
kéen give conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C1,
yiɗi say conjClass:prefix
joogsó stop oneself conjClass:suffix, conjSubClass:C3A,
yiqiin know conjClass:prefix
yahay be conjClass:prefix,
yiil be (in a place) conjClass:prefix
qaadó take for oneself conjClass:suffix, subConj:C3B

section.title: Index of Morphosyntactic Properties: Standard Somali
section.para: Standard Somali paradigms employ the following property-value dimensions

listitem.para: PNG
Standard Somali follows the Cushitic-Omotic PNG Pattern.

theme: [There is no paradigmatic information on this property as such in Saeed1999. As in Afar, it is considered to be a morphologically non-productive lexical property, which however has certain detectable reflexes in the phonological shape of certain classes of verb stems.]

Inflection Class: [As in all inflectional languages, phonological and grammaticization processes conspire to create more or less marked morphophonemic differences in the verbal inflections of different sets of verbs.]

conjClass [This is the fundamental division between inherited Afroasiatic prefixing conjugation and a suffixing conjugation innovated independently in specific branches of Afroasiatic. Cf.the general discussion of Afroasiatic prefixing and suffixing conjugations.] -- VALUES:

section.title: Index of Archive Paradigms: Standard Somali
section.para: The following tabel lists the shared property:value pairs for each paradigm, and then the variable property=value-list (comma separated). The abbreviation "PNG" in the paradigm variable-value lists stands for: gender:f,m,⊤ number:pl,sg person:p1,p2,p3 I.e., the PNG combinations normal with finite tam-forms.Clicking on the paradigmLabel will yield a display of the paradigm in question [either by link to hard-coded term cluster, or canned SPARQL query].

td.literallayout: future pastGeneral pastProgressive presentGeneral presentProgressive presentProgressive2
